children.subject:
Unfortunately I think the answer to this depends a lot on you, but I can give you my experience. 

161 ended up having more work in projects than I expected. I found the class to be a little unfulfilling. It feels like a really surface level survey of security concepts. I did enjoy the cryptography section. Tests and homework were on the easier side, however the projects took me much more time than I expected. They also weren't very fulfilling projects. I didn't feel the projects taught me much They aren't as large as projects in design classes but I would not underestimate the time they will take.  

The difficulty of 189 will very based off of your familiarity with linear algebra, probability, and to a lesser degree calculus. I would look at notes from previous classes, if the math feels comfortable that in my experience is a good indication of how the class will feel. I took 189 with Shewchuk and I loved the class. In all, I would say I spent less time on 189 than 161 and I did the same in both of them grade wise. I attribute the time disparity to the time drain of projects in 161. 

I haven't taken EE127 but I believe if you are familiar with linear algebra and calculus the optimization you need to know for 189 will not be prohibitively difficult to learn and you won't need to take 127 before taking 189. This was my personal experience but others may have other advice. 

If I were you, and I were to cut a class it would be 161, but that largely is because I am not a fan of project classes. Of all of the classes I took at Cal, I would say 161 was among the least useful as well, but that largely is a function of the field I have decided to go into. 

I hope that helps, good luck with your decision.
First 3rd of 127 is linear algebra topics so it might be less useful to take it concurrently because you start learning about optimization after 1/3 of the semester has already passed

history.content: I have read posts from Prof Sahai that EECS 126, 127 are good preparation courses for CS 189. I am currenlty enrolled  in EECS 126 and were planning to enroll concurrently in CS 189, EECS 127 for fall 2018. Is that a good idea? I was also thinking of taking a CS 161 for fall 2018. I am worried that taking  189,127, 161 might be too much load, so one option might be to take CS189, CS 161 in fall 2018 and take EECS 127 in spring 2019. Is delaying EECS 127 advisable? Please advise on pros and cons. Thanks
history.subject: EECS 127, CS189
